I used a rotary tool with the attachment shown.\u003cbr\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"lightbox-wrapper\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"lightbox\" href=\"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/4X/2/b/6/2b60a3b4bb0f55762b54d17fa8ad9b13133c6413.jpeg\" data-download-href=\"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/2b60a3b4bb0f55762b54d17fa8ad9b13133c6413\" title=\"IMG_20250414_140042377\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/optimized/4X/2/b/6/2b60a3b4bb0f55762b54d17fa8ad9b13133c6413_2_375x500.jpeg\" alt=\"IMG_20250414_140042377\" data-base62-sha1=\"6bJzYSjxBikXjiSILyKHbEPGLOr\" width=\"375\" height=\"500\" srcset=\"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/optimized/4X/2/b/6/2b60a3b4bb0f55762b54d17fa8ad9b13133c6413_2_375x500.jpeg, https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/optimized/4X/2/b/6/2b60a3b4bb0f55762b54d17fa8ad9b13133c6413_2_562x750.jpeg 1.5x, https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/optimized/4X/2/b/6/2b60a3b4bb0f55762b54d17fa8ad9b13133c6413_2_750x1000.jpeg 2x\" data-dominant-color=\"978E85\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"meta\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"fa d-icon d-icon-far-image svg-icon\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cuse href=\"#far-image\"\u003e\u003c/use\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003cspan class=\"filename\"\u003eIMG_20250414_140042377\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"informations\"\u003e1920√ó2560 176 KB\u003c/span\u003e\u003csvg class=\"fa d-icon d-icon-discourse-expand svg-icon\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cuse href=\"#discourse-expand\"\u003e\u003c/use\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\nI worked the surface until the ridges were removed from an area the size of the patch. I applied the adhesive as directed. After five minutes, I was able to fully inflate the algae. If the hole was difficult to find, I inflated the algae enough so it help its shape, found the hole, and followed the same procedure. So far, all the algae repaired this way are still holding air with no leakage.\u003cbr\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"lightbox-wrapper\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"lightbox\"
